1.text: I made a covenant with mine eyes; How then should I look upon a virgin?

2.text: For what is the portion from God above, And the heritage from the Almighty on high?

3.text: Is it not calamity to the unrighteous, And disaster to the workers of iniquity?

4.text: Doth not he see my ways, And number all my steps?

5.text: If I have walked with falsehood, And my foot hath hasted to deceit

6.text: (Let me be weighed in an even balance, That God may know mine integrity);

7.text: If my step hath turned out of the way, And my heart walked after mine eyes, And if any spot hath cleaved to my hands:

8.text: Then let me sow, and let another eat; Yea, let the produce of my field be rooted out.

9.text: If my heart hath been enticed unto a woman, And I have laid wait at my neighbor’s door;

10.text: Then let my wife grind unto another, And let others bow down upon her.

11.text: For that were a heinous crime; Yea, it were an iniquity to be punished by the judges:

12.text: For it is a fire that consumeth unto Destruction, And would root out all mine increase.

13.text: If I have despised the cause of my man-servant or of my maid-servant, When they contended with me;

14.text: What then shall I do when God riseth up? And when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?

15.text: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? And did not one fashion us in the womb?

16.text: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, Or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail,

17.text: Or have eaten my morsel alone, And the fatherless hath not eaten thereof

18.text: (Nay, from my youth he grew up with me as with a father, And her have I guided from my mother’s womb);

19.text: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, Or that the needy had no covering;

20.text: If his loins have not blessed me, And if he hath not been warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

21.text: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, Because I saw my help in the gate:

22.text: Then let my shoulder fall from the shoulder-blade, And mine arm be broken from the bone.

23.text: For calamity from God is a terror to me, And by reason of his majesty I can do nothing.

24.text: If I have made gold my hope, And have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;

25.text: If I have rejoiced because my wealth was great, And because my hand had gotten much;

26.text: If I have beheld the sun when it shined, Or the moon walking in brightness,

27.text: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, And my mouth hath kissed my hand:

28.text: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judges; For I should have denied the God that is above.

29.text: If I have rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, Or lifted up myself when evil found him

30.text: (Yea, I have not suffered by mouth to sin By asking his life with a curse);

31.text: If the men of my tent have not said, Who can find one that hath not been filled with his meat?

32.text: (The sojourner hath not lodged in the street; But I have opened my doors to the traveller);

33.text: If like Adam I have covered my transgressions, By hiding mine iniquity in my bosom,

34.text: Because I feared the great multitude, And the contempt of families terrified me, So that I kept silence, and went not out of the door—

35.text: Oh that I had one to hear me! (Lo, here is my signature, let the Almighty answer me) And that I had the indictment which mine adversary hath written!

36.text: Surely I would carry it upon my shoulder; I would bind it unto me as a crown:

37.text: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; As a prince would I go near unto him.

38.text: If my land crieth out against me, And the furrows thereof weep together;

39.text: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, Or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:

40.text: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, And cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
